subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Your setUp() method fails halfway, so only half of the resources need to be freed. ... No, it s not the tests that are failing, it s the setUp. Imagine you
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> What is a partial failure?

Your setUp() method fails halfway, so only half of the resources need to be
freed.

> The set up belongs to the test. I think it is reasonable to
> say the test fails if its setup fails.

No, it's not the tests that are failing, it's the setUp.

Imagine you have 100 tests and 1 set up. The setUp fails, and now JUnit is
telling you you have "101 FAILURES"... Very helpful! And QA will freak out
on you. And I'm sure you already know you can't "trust" this report and
that you are actually looking at a cascade failure.

Compare this to "1 FAILURE, 100 SKIPS".

Now, *that* is a much more acurate view of what really happened.

--
